text:
Broadway, west side, south from Waverly to Washington Places, showing the old New York Hotel occupying the entire frontage involved. This structure bore No. 721 and was a favorite resort of the Southerners before and after the Civil War. Many stories were told of how blockade running plots originated here. it was erected in 1847. Randolph Guggenheimer had it removed in 1896 for his 12 story New York Commercial Building. Note the absence of street car tracks.

About 1870

Gift of Urbrock Collection

"New York Hotel" p.107
Broadway, bet. Waverley place & Washington Place

Pelletreau, William S.
Early New York houses with historical - genealogical notes.
New York: Francis P. Harper, 1900.

#739-741 Broadway West side, between North Waverly Place and E. 8th Street.

January 8th, 1914.

Wurts Brothers,
